intro: Pyrenoglyphis gastoniana, commonly known as the Gaston's pyrenoglyphis, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers and palmate leaves. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
